bibl.title: Sam Gum v. Henry M. White. Order to Show Cause
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington,
In the Matter of the Application of SAM GUM, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

The above petitioner having made application to this court for a writ of habeas corpus, addressed to United States Commissioner of Immigration Henry M. White, or to the Assistant United States Commissioner of Immigration, and to such persons or agents acting by, through or under him or in behalf of the United States Government, in whose custody the petitioner is shown by his petition to be confined and restrained of his liberty, as alleged in his petition, illegally and unwarranted and without power or authority of the statutes of the United States, and the court being fully advised in the premises;

IT IS ORDERED that the Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, or the Assistant United States Commissioner of Immigration, in charge of the Immigration Station and Detention House at Seattle, or such persons acting under or in behalf of said Commissioner or the United States Government having charge of said Sam Gum, show cause before this Court at the courtroom in the Federal Building in the City of Seattle, on the 27th day of June, 1921, at 10 o'clock in the forenoon of said day, why said application should not be granted, and in the meantime, your, the United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, and you, the said Assistant Commissioner of Immigration, J. S. Sargent, as well as said persons who are acting under and through you, in behalf of the United States Government, in the Immigration Department of the United States at Seattle, refrain and
desist from deporting or placing and removing said petitioner, Sam Gum, from said District, or carrying into effect any warrant or order for his deportation which may be held by you or either of you.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that a certified copy of this Order shall be served upon the United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, or upon J.S. Sargent, Assistant Commissioner of Immigration, or any such Government official in charge of said Sam Gum, as sufficient authority for the above instruction, and 1st bail be fixed in the sum of $1,000.00.
Done in open court this 26th 27th day of April, 1921.
Received a copy of the within order this day of April 1921.
Filed in the United States District Court
